title: Invasion of Poland
description: Germany invades Poland, marking the start of World War II.

title: Battle of Britain
description: The Royal Air Force defends the United Kingdom against large-scale attacks by Nazi Germany's air force.

title: Pearl Harbor Attack
description: Japan launches a surprise military strike on the United States naval base at Pearl Harbor, leading the U.S. to enter World War II.

title: Battle of Midway
description: A decisive naval battle in the Pacific Theater, which turned the tide in favor of the Allies.

title: Battle of Stalingrad
description: One of the deadliest battles in history, where the Soviet Union defeated Nazi Germany's Sixth Army.

title: D-Day Invasion
description: Allied forces land on the beaches of Normandy, France, marking the start of the liberation of Western Europe.

title: Battle of the Bulge
description: The last major German offensive campaign on the Western Front, which ultimately failed and depleted German resources.

title: Yalta Conference
description: Meeting of the Allied leaders Franklin D. Roosevelt, Winston Churchill, and Joseph Stalin to discuss the post-war reorganization of Europe.

title: VE Day
description: Victory in Europe Day, marking the formal acceptance of Nazi Germany's unconditional surrender.

title: Atomic Bombing of Hiroshima
description: The United States drops the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima, Japan, leading to the end of World War II.

title: Atomic Bombing of Nagasaki
description: The United States drops the second atomic bomb on Nagasaki, Japan, leading to Japan's surrender.

title: VJ Day
description: Victory over Japan Day, marking the end of World War II with Japan's formal surrender.

title: Battle of El Alamein
description: A major turning point in the Western Desert Campaign, where Allied forces defeated the Axis powers in North Africa.

title: Battle of Kursk
description: The largest tank battle in history, resulting in a decisive Soviet victory over Nazi Germany.

title: Battle of Iwo Jima
description: A major battle in which U.S. Marines captured the island of Iwo Jima from the Imperial Japanese Army.

title: Battle of Okinawa
description: The largest amphibious assault in the Pacific War during World War II, resulting in an Allied victory.

title: Liberation of Paris
description: The French Resistance, with the help of Allied forces, liberated Paris from German occupation.

title: Tehran Conference
description: Meeting of Joseph Stalin, Franklin D. Roosevelt, and Winston Churchill in Tehran to discuss military strategy and post-war Europe.

title: Manhattan Project
description: A research and development project during World War II that produced the first nuclear weapons.
